627	
628	* sf - simple_salesforce connected to your org. [1]
629	* org_config - local information about your org. [2]
630	* project_config - information about your project. [3]
631	* tooling - simple_salesforce connected to the tooling API on your org.
632	* query() - SOQL query. `help(query)` for more information
633	* describe() - Inspect object fields. `help(describe)` for more information
634	* help() - for interactive help on Python
635	* help(obj) - for help on any specific Python object or module
636	
637	[1] https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce

>> Issue: [B824:url_found] url_found
   Severity: Medium   Confidence: Medium
   Location: /home/blue/PyPIAgent/Dataset/study/unzip_benign/cumulusci-4.3.0/cumulusci-4.3.0/cumulusci/tasks/bulkdata/generate_and_load_data.py:19
   More Info: https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b824_url_found.html
18	
19	    task_docs = """
20	    Orchestrate creating tempfiles, generating data, loading data, cleaning up tempfiles and batching.
21	
22	    CCI has features for generating data and for loading them into orgs. This task pulls them
23	    together to give some useful additional features, such as storing the intermediate data in
24	    a tempfile (the default behavior) and generating the data in batches instead of all at
25	    once (controlled by the `batch_size` option).
26	
27	    The simplest possible usage is to specify the number of records you'd like generated, a
28	    mapping file that defines the schema and a data generation task written in Python to actually
29	    generate the data.
30	
31	    Use the `num_records` option to specify how many records to generate.
32	    Use the `mapping` option to specify a mapping file.
33	    Use 'data_generation_task' to specify what Python class to use to generate the data.'
34	    Use 'batch_size' to specify how many records to generate and upload in every batch.
35	
36	    By default it creates the data in a temporary file and then cleans it up later. Specify database_url if you
37	    need more control than that. Existing data tables will be emptied before being refilled.
38	    Your database will be completely deleted!
39	
40	    If you use database_url and batch_size together, latter batches will overwrite
41	    earlier batches in the database and the first batch will replace tables if they exist.
42	
43	    A table mapping IDs to SFIds will persist across batches and will grow monotonically.
44	
45	    If your generator class makes heavy use of Faker, you might be interested in this patch
46	    which frequently speeds Faker up. Adding that code to the bottom of your generator file may
47	    help accelerate it.
48	
49	    https://sfdc.co/bwKxDD
50	    """
51	
52	    task_options = {

664	    def create_id(self, length):
665	        characters = [*digits, *ascii_lowercase]
666	        return "".join([choice(characters) for i in range(length)])

>> Issue: [B824:url_found] url_found
   Severity: Medium   Confidence: Medium
   Location: /home/blue/PyPIAgent/Dataset/study/unzip_benign/cumulusci-4.3.0/cumulusci-4.3.0/cumulusci/tasks/metadata_etl/base.py:356
   More Info: https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b824_url_found.html
355	class UpdateMetadataFirstChildTextTask(MetadataSingleEntityTransformTask):
356	    task_docs = """
357	Metadata ETL task to update a single child element's text within metadata XML.
358	
359	If the child doesn't exist, the child is created and appended to the Metadata.   Furthermore, the ``value`` option is namespaced injected if the task is properly configured.
360	
361	Example: Assign a Custom Object's Compact Layout
362	------------------------------------------------
363	
364	Researching `CustomObject <https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_meta.meta/api_meta/customobject.htm>`_ in the Metadata API documentation or even retrieving the CustomObject's Metadata for inspection, we see the ``compactLayoutAssignment`` Field.  We want to assign a specific Compact Layout for our Custom Object, so we write the following CumulusCI task in our project's ``cumulusci.yml``.
365	
366	.. code-block::  yaml
367	
368	  tasks:
369	      assign_compact_layout:
370	          class_path: cumulusci.tasks.metadata_etl.UpdateMetadataFirstChildTextTask
371	          options:
372	              managed: False
373	              namespace_inject: $project_config.project__package__namespace
374	              entity: CustomObject
375	              api_names: OurCustomObject__c
376	              tag: compactLayoutAssignment
377	              value: "%%%NAMESPACE%%%DifferentCompactLayout"
378	              # We include a namespace token so it's easy to use this task in a managed context.
379	
380	Suppose the original CustomObject metadata XML looks like:
381	
382	.. code-block:: xml
383	
384	  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
385	  <CustomObject xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
386	      ...
387	      <label>Our Custom Object</label>
388	      <compactLayoutAssignment>OriginalCompactLayout</compactLayoutAssignment>
389	      ...
390	  </CustomObject>
391	
392	After running ``cci task run assign_compact_layout``, the CustomObject metadata XML is deployed as:
393	
394	.. code-block:: xml
395	
396	  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
397	  <CustomObject xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">
398	      ...
399	      <label>Our Custom Object</label>
400	      <compactLayoutAssignment>DifferentCompactLayout</compactLayoutAssignment>
401	      ...
402	  </CustomObject>
403	    """
404	
405	    task_options = {

--------------------------------------------------

   Severity: Medium   Confidence: Medium
   Location: /home/blue/PyPIAgent/Dataset/study/unzip_benign/cumulusci-4.3.0/cumulusci-4.3.0/cumulusci/tasks/metadata_etl/layouts.py:446
   More Info: https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b824_url_found.html
445	class AddRecordPlatformActionListItem(MetadataSingleEntityTransformTask):
446	    task_docs = """
447	        Inserts the targeted lightning button/action into specified
448	        layout's PlatformActionList with a 'Record' actionListContext.
449	        - If the targeted lightning button/action already exists,
450	            the layout metadata is not modified.
451	        - If there is no 'Record' context PlatformActionList,
452	            we will generate one and add the specified action
453	
454	        Task definition example:
455	
456	            dev_inject_apply_quick_action_into_account_layout:
457	            group: "Demo config and storytelling"
458	            description: Adds an Apply Quick Action button to the beggining of the button list on the Experiences Account Layout.
459	            class_path: tasks.layouts.InsertRecordPlatformActionListItem
460	            options:
461	                api_names: "Account-%%%NAMESPACE%%%Experiences Account Layout"
462	                action_name: "Account.Apply"
463	                action_type: QuickAction
464	                place_first: True
465	
466	        Reference Documentation:
467	        https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_meta.meta/api_meta/meta_layouts.htm#PlatformActionList
468	        """
469	
470	    entity = "Layout"
